thread.title: Tributes to 'beautiful' mum-of-four killed by train at Wigan station
thread.title_full: Tributes to 'beautiful' mum-of-four killed by train at Wigan station

author: Jon Macpherson
title: Tributes to 'beautiful' mum-of-four killed by train at Wigan station
text:
Friends have paid tribute to Charlotte Cash who was reportedly killed by a train at Wigan North Western Share Get daily   
Tributes have been paid to a ‘beautiful’ mum-of-four who was killed by a train after giving her bag to a stranger. 
Family and friends have named Charlotte Cash as the woman who was hit by a Virgin train at Wigan North Western station on Friday afternoon. 
Witnesses said the 34-year-old had been sending a text message on her mobile phone moments before she was struck by the London-bound train. 
Commuters at the station, including Team GB athlete Jenny Meadows, were left ‘heartbroken’ and ‘shaken’ after witnessing the incident at around 3.15pm. 
Jenny, who is an 800-metre runner, wrote on Twitter: “She was texting & had a short conversation with a lady. The lady said she seemed fine. Read More 
“I’m just shaken! That poor girl’s family - I cannot bare to think how they are feeling.” 
Friends and family have paid tribute on social media to Charlotte, who is from Wigan. 
Her half-brother Stephen Cash wrote on facebook: “RIP Charlotte Cash. Finding out this morning that my half sister is the person who was hit by a train yesterday. Hope your in a better place now. You always seemed so bubbly and smiling when I saw you. Love from all the family xxx” 
Darren Conroy wrote: “Sorry to hear this, my thoughts are with you and your family at this sad time :-( may you rest in peace Charlotte.” Emergency services were called to Wigan North Western on Friday afternoon 
Damian Jones wrote: “Charlotte Cash may your beautiful soul rest in peace. I am proud to have been able to call you my friend.” 
Mike James wrote: “Awful news about Charlotte Cash don’t know what to say, very shocked. Had some good times growing up and raving in pier. Sleep tight luv xxx” 
Witnesses reported passengers screaming before they were led from the station in tears. 
Student Rob Pritchard told The Mirror : “I was at the other end of the platform and heard people closer to the incident shouting and screaming.” Read More 
Emergency services were called to Wigan North Western station on Wallgate at 3.15pm. 
The line was closed with trains in and out of the station suspended. 
A BTP spokesman said: “A woman has sadly died after she was struck by a train at Wigan North Western station. 
“Officers from British Transport Police were called to the station shortly after 3.15pm and attended alongside paramedics from the North West Ambulance Service. 
“This incident is not being treated as suspicious and officers are now working to identify the woman and inform her family. 
“A file will be prepared for the coroner.” 
A spokesman for the North West Ambulance Service confirmed they were called to the scene at 3.14pm and that no one was taken to hospital. 
Trains were cancelled and the station was closed to passengers. Like us on Facebook
